ca.ualberta.cs.lonelytwitter

Class AbstractTweet

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cs.lonelytwitter.AbstractTweet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tweetable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImportantTweet, NormalTweet

    public abstract class AbstractTweet
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tweetable
    An abstract class that all types of tweets extend. Also implements the Tweetable interface.
    Author:
    Mark Langen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractTweet(java.util.Date created, java.lang.String message)
      Constructor for an AbstractTweet, creates a new tweet with a given content to be published on a given date.
      AbstractTweet(java.lang.String message)
      Create a tweet with the date of publishing equal to the current date.

                throws TweetTooLongException
        Modify the message in a tweet. Throws an error if the new message is too long to fit in a tweet.

        message - The message to change the contents to
        Throws:

      • isImportant

        public abstract boolean isImportant()
        Flag marking whether a tweet is important or not. Important tweets are shown with a more eye-catching look in the UI.
        Returns:
        The current state of the flag

      • addMood

        public void addMood(AbstractMood mood)
        Add a mood to the tweet, describing the mood of the user when they published it.
        Parameters:
        mood - The mood to add to the tweet

      • getMoodList

        public java.util.List<AbstractMood> getMoodList()
        Get a list of all of the moods that the tweet currently has. A reference to the list should not be kept between invocations of other methods of the tweet object.
        Returns:
        A list of the moods
